thread.title: Ronda Rousey set to play prison inmate in guest role on NBC's 'Blindspot'
thread.title_full: Ronda Rousey set to play prison inmate in guest role on NBC's 'Blindspot'

author: Sara Harris (sharris@sportingnews.com)
title: Ronda Rousey set to play prison inmate in guest role on NBC's 'Blindspot'
text:
February 22, 2017 9:24am EST February 22, 2017 9:09am EST The episode has not been shot yet and is scheduled to air in early May, according to TMZ Sports. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 9:24 a.m. ET 
Updated at 9:24 a.m. ET 
Ronda Rousey has landed her next acting gig. 
The former UFC women's bantamweight champion has scored herself a guest role as a prison inmate on the hit NBC drama "Blindspot." 
The network released a statement about Rousey's role on the show to the Washington Post : 
“Rousey will be playing Devon Penberthy: a female prison inmate who grew up in a working-class family from the White Mountains of New Hampshire and is serving time for transporting weapons across state lines. She is a tough, athletic woman who knows how to fight and handle a weapon.” 
MORE: Ronda Rousey was a pioneer for women in UFC 
The episode has not been shot yet and is scheduled to air in early May, according to TMZ Sports . 
The 30-year-old has made no plans to return to the octagon, after getting knocked out in her past two fights.
